summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of a BOP Material Handler at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, conducted on September 30, 2019. The interviewee details his activities and observations during his shift on August 9, 2019, the night Jeffrey Epstein died, including the distribution of commissary and food in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

persons.name: Material Handler
persons.role: Bureau of Prisons Material Handler at MCC
persons.context: The primary interviewee who worked his normal 8am-4pm shift and overtime in the SHU on August 9, 2019, helping with commissary and food distribution, including to Epstein's cell.

persons.name: FBI Special Agent
persons.context: Present for the interview of the Material Handler at the USAO, SDNY.

persons.name: Office of the Inspector General SA
persons.context: Present for the interview of the Material Handler at the USAO, SDNY.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Present for the interview, advised the proffer agreement was in effect.

persons.name: NOEL
persons.context: A correctional officer working in the SHU on August 9, 2019, who informed the Material Handler about the 4pm count and assisted with the food feed.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate in the SHU's L-Tier who received food from the Material Handler on the night of his death.

connections.description: Worked together during the SHU shift on August 9, 2019; NOEL informed him about the 4pm count and they worked on the food feed.
The Material Handler delivered food to Epstein's cell on L-Tier for approximately 60 seconds on the night of August 9, 2019.

events.title: Epstein's Last Day in SHU
events.description: The Material Handler worked his normal 8am-4pm shift and overtime in the SHU, distributing commissary and food, including to Epstein's cell on L-Tier.

events.title: FBI Interview of Material Handler
events.description: The Material Handler was interviewed by FBI and OIG agents and an AUSA at the USAO, SDNY, regarding his activities and observations on August 9, 2019.
personsInvolved: Office of the Inspector General SA

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York
United States Attorneys Office (USAO), Southern District of New York (SDNY), New York, New York
L-Tier in the SHU at MCC
keyFacts: The Material Handler delivered food to Jeffrey Epstein's cell on L-Tier for no more than 60 seconds on the night of August 9, 2019.
The 4pm inmate count in the SHU on August 9 was conducted by officers already present, not by the Material Handler who arrived for overtime around 4:15pm.
The Material Handler stated it was against MCC policy for an officer to go down the tiers alone without another officer assisting.
The interview was conducted under a proffer agreement, indicating the Material Handler was providing information potentially in exchange for limited immunity.
The document records the Material Handler's uncertainty about specific times and whether other officers checked on Epstein later in the evening.
